alert.note: Alert for Rio Grande (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 11:58AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following county, Rio Grande. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 AM AST, Radar Doppler indicated heavy rain has ended. However, excessive runoff persists causing some flooding in roadways in some areas. USGS river sensors indicate that Rio Grande and Rio Espiritu have elevated streamflows. Therefore, urban and small stream flooding are still likely. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
